wikipedia_page.main: George Spencer Watson R.O.I., R.P., A.R.A., R.A. (8 March 1869, in London – 11 April 1934, in London) was an English portrait artist of the late romantic school who sometimes worked in the style of the Italian Renaissance.

response: * George Spencer Watson, portrait artist of the late romantic school who sometimes worked in the style of the Italian Renaissance.
* George Spencer Watson (1869–1934), English portrait artist
His portrait was painted by George Spencer Watson in 1928. He died on 26 May 1946 at his home, Sutton Veny House.
*Portrait of Rodolph de Salis by George Spencer Watson in the Waterways Museum in Gloucester. (The BBC caption is misleading, he was not 'Henry Rudolf', Henry Rodolph was a cousin.)
In 1934, George Spencer Watson took the portrait, "Baba" Beaton, Mrs. Alec Hambro.

Watson was born in London and in 1923 her family moved to a country house in Dorset. Her father was the artist George Spencer Watson and her mother, Hilda, was a dancer and mime artist. Her father purchased Dunshay Manor, which became Watson's home for the rest of her life. The family decorated the Manor in the arts and crafts style and used its outbuildings as studios and for dance and theatre productions. Dunshay Manor was near Langton Matravers on the Isle of Purbeck and there were several stone quarries in the area. Watson became fascinated by the masons and quarrymen she saw working the local Purbeck stone with traditional tools and decided to become a sculptor.
